summary: This is an email chain from June 20, 2008, forwarding a submission from attorneys Jay Lefkowitz and Kenneth Starr to DOJ officials regarding the Epstein case. The email includes attachments containing legal arguments and allegations of misconduct, indicating high-level legal advocacy on Epstein's behalf.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Recipient of forwarded email regarding Epstein case materials submitted by defense attorneys.

persons.name: John Roth
persons.context: Primary recipient of the initial submission from Epstein's defense team; coordinates timing for a follow-up call.

persons.name: Ami Sheth
persons.context: Sent the email on behalf of Jay Lefkowitz and Kenneth Starr, attaching legal documents regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Attorney from Kirkland & Ellis LLP representing Jeffrey Epstein; co-author of the legal submission forwarded to the DOJ.

persons.name: Kenneth Starr
persons.context: Attorney from Kirkland & Ellis LLP representing Jeffrey Epstein; co-author of the legal submission forwarded to the DOJ.

persons.name: Stephanie Thacker
persons.context: Author of one of the attached documents (Response to CEOS's Letter) included in the defense submission.

connections.description: Co-authors of the legal submission on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein, both partners at Kirkland & Ellis LLP.
Lefkowitz is acting as defense attorney for Epstein, as evidenced by the legal submission to the DOJ.
Starr is acting as defense attorney for Epstein, as evidenced by the legal submission to the DOJ.
Roth received the submission from Lefkowitz and plans to call him to discuss the matter.
Colleagues within the DOJ/US Attorney's office, with Roth forwarding case materials to Acosta.

events.title: Letter sent to John Roth
events.description: A letter was sent from Epstein's defense team to DOJ official John Roth, referenced as occurring 'yesterday'.

events.title: Legal submission forwarded to DOJ
events.description: Epstein's defense attorneys, via Ami Sheth, electronically submitted a package of legal documents (Principal Submission, Summary of Misconduct, etc.) to the DOJ.

keyFacts: High-profile defense attorneys Jay Lefkowitz and Kenneth Starr were actively representing Jeffrey Epstein in 2008, submitting detailed legal arguments to the Department of Justice.
The submission included a 'Summary of Misconduct', suggesting the defense was making allegations of improper conduct by prosecutors or investigators.
The communication shows coordination between senior DOJ officials (Alex Acosta, John Roth) and Epstein's powerful legal team regarding the case.
The email chain indicates the defense was seeking an in-person meeting with DOJ officials to discuss their submissions.
The correspondence is dated June 2008, during the period when Epstein's controversial non-prosecution agreement was being negotiated.
